brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to determine the absolute bioavailability of YH4808 using simultaneous oral
      therapeutic- and [14C]-labeled intravenous microdoses.

clinical_study.brief_title: Absolute Bioavailability of YH4808 With Accelerator Mass Spectrometry(AMS)-Based Microdose Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy male subject aged 20 to 45 at screening

          -  subjects who have weight over 55 kg with BMI ranged from 20.0 to 25.0

          -  subjects who decide to participate voluntarily and write a informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects who have clinically significant disease of cardiovascular, respiratory,
             renal, endocrinological, hematological, gastrointestinal, neurological(central
             nervous system), psychiatric disorders or malignant tumor

          -  clinically significant allergic disease (except for mild allergic rhinitis)

          -  subjects who have determined not eligible by screening test (medical history,
             physical examination, 12-lead ECG, laboratory test, etc) within 28 days of study
             start

          -  subjects considered unsuitable for inclusion by the investigator

link.description: Webpage of clinical trial center of Seoul National University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Determine the Absolute Bioavailability of YH4808 Using Simultaneous Oral Therapeutic- and [14C]-Labeled Intravenous Microdoses

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
